articles.title: Legendary songwriter Burt Bacharach dead at 94 - News24
articles.description: Legendary American pop composer Burt Bacharach, whose prolific output provided a chart-topping playlist for the 1960s and 70s with hits like "I Say a Little Prayer," has died in Los Angeles aged 94, US media said Thursday.
articles.content:
• Composer Burt Bacharach has died at the age of 94.
  • Bacharach worked with stars such as Dionne Warwick, Aretha Franklin, Dusty Springfield and Tom Jones.
  • The legendary composer… [+1768 chars]

articles.title: Maura Higgins fuels romance rumours as she cosies up to younger man on holidays - Sunday World
articles.description: Maura Higgins was pictured kissing and cuddling with a young American businessman during her recent trip to Mexico.
articles.content: The former Love Island star (32) jetted over to Tulum last month, where she was snapped cosying up to 24-year-old Yisroel Solomon at a local beach club.Maura Higgins was pictured kissing and cuddling… [+67 chars]

articles.title: Musician starts foul Margaret Court chant - news.com.au
articles.description: American superstar Phoebe Bridgers has gone viral after leading a foul-mouthed chant abusing Margaret Court during a gig at the Melbourne arena named in the Aussie sporting great’s honour this week.

articles.title: Africa could rescue US as lithium demand projected to surge 42 times - News24
articles.description: The United States is still very much in the race for lithium deposits in Africa and South America, but China has jumped ahead.
articles.content:
• Zimbabwe, DRC, Ghana, Namibia, and Mali have a combined 4.38 million tons of lithium resources.
